name: Novotel Cardiff Centre

reviews.text: I booked this hotel from reading other reviews and was glad I did. The service is excellent, car parking plentiful, swimming pool not big but lovely and the superior room we stayed in was more than adequate for us, our 9 year old and baby. Breakfast is good too with lots of choice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only minor point is that it is a bit far too walk to the bay, maybe in the summer you could but it was a bit too cold for us in feb, but nevertherless it was a small price to pay for such a good hotel and it is quite easy to park in the bay area anyway.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.text: If you are planning to eat out don't bother with the Old Orleans at the Red Dragon Centre, cheap plastic food, was a real disappointment.
reviews.title: love this hotel - have been back already!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great deal on this hotel £66 for a room for the night with breakfast. Arrived at hotel on the saturday and got a room on floor 5 was expecting a small room but had a double bed and a double sofa bed Plenty of room Nice big bathroom with bath with shower over it and a seperate shower cubical Staff were very friendly and the breakfast was great loads of choice to suit all. also was served from 8 till 12 so no need to rush
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, very relaxing, brilliant location.

reviews.text: My husband and I and our 1 year old son have stayed twice at the Novotel since Jan 2008. He is relocating to Cardiff and the agency put us there for our first visit, and afterwards we requested it for the second one.
reviews.title: Nice, bug room

likes.disliked: — Location - just a bit too far out from anywhere to eat/walk to comfortably

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Hubby and I stopped here on a Friday night as we going to a Wedding in Caerphilly.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but rather expensive we thought

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid £94. This included the room, breakfast and the car park and i must say we were quite disappointed!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location, good food

likes.liked: — close to city centre, good room service(nice food) and nice big rooms,comfy beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked direct with the hotel a few weeks ago and i was certain the price was only £65, and i must have assumed this included breakfast... how silly i was.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The staff were nice, had a smoking room though and it did smell a bit but we did need to check in early (so much for the ban).
reviews.title: Lovely new hotel

likes.liked: — comfy beds, lovely accommodation, quiet room
likes.disliked: — separate toilet 'room' from shower room/ bath - it had no sink to wash hands in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that the room was clean but basic, although the bed was lovely!
reviews.title: Good Stay!
Pleasant short stay
reviews.text: Hotel Novotel Quite expensive, but a very pleasant stay. Used the pool a number of times during my two day stay and exercise facilities also available. Breakfast excellent which was included in my rate. Snack food and meals expensive. Reception staff excellent. Very pleasant and helpful especially a young lady named Laila. If you want a quiet room ask for one facing the car park as many of the rooms face a busy road. It is easier to walk into the city centre than take a local bus as the buses (well those I found) only run approximately every 30 mins.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was excellent, it's in a great location; 10-15mins walk to Mermaid Quay and same into the city centre. The staff were all exceptional and offered high service. The breakfast was wonderful- continental and cooked items.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful time and would definately stay here again!!
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Novotel on 13th, check in was fine although we couldn't check in till 2pm, the receptionist staff could have been a bit more friendly, they weren't too bad though. We was expecting the room to be a bit bigger as there was 3 of us (1 child of 10yrs), and reading the last review they obviously had bigger room as we did not have a separate shower and bath, and it definately wasn't a big room. We had no proper cushions on our bed, just square ones that you have on a sofa, there was one on the pull out bed! The room was pleasant although I'm sure we should have had a bigger room, had booked 2 months in advance too.
reviews.title: Loved Cardiff Bay!

likes.liked: — lovely view from terrace, comfy beds and tasty breakfasts

reviews.text: Great location near to Cardiff Bay (Red Dragon Centre for Doctor Who) ten min walk and Cardiff Town Centre about 15min walk. Swimming Pool was very nice, very crowded as it is not big, so couldn't really enjoy it greatly.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — Stylish, clean and comfortable with a central location

reviews.text: Having never stayed at a Novotel before I thought it would be nothing more than a step up from a Travel Lodge, a bland concrete box with no character. How wrong I was. The building has been dramatically converted from a warehouse to an ultra modern hotel with fantastic facilities.
reviews.title: A Nice Surprise!

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated with all the usual amenities including air con, safe, laptop and MP3 connections and a clean and functional bathroom. The beds are really comfortable too - I could have slept forever!
reviews.title: Comfortable, conveniently situated hotel with pool and gym

likes.liked: — Very quiet, well insulated rooms and good leisure facilities

description: The Novotel Cardiff Centre is a 4 star hotel perfect for your next break in Cardiff. Close to live sports action at Millennium Stadium and shops, restaurants and entertainment at Cardiff Bay. Enjoy our Elements Restaurant and Bar, superb indoor swimming pool, gym, sauna, steam bath and whirlpool. Guests on a business trip will find WiFi internet and nine meeting rooms at their disposal including The Warehouse, a fabulous venue for weddings and conferences alike. 120 parking spaces at GBP 8 per day.
